content.p:
ยง 10-112. Military voter; voting. The military voter shall mark the
military ballot provided for in this article in the same manner as an
absentee ballot. After marking the ballot, he or she shall fold such
ballot and enclose it in the inner affirmation envelope bearing the
military voter's affirmation on the outside of the envelope and seal the
envelope. He or she shall then sign the affirmation, with the blanks
properly filled in. The inner affirmation envelope containing the
military ballot shall then be inserted in the outer envelope addressed
to the appropriate board of elections, which shall be mailed or
personally delivered to such board of elections of his or her county of
residence within the time limits provided by this chapter.
